physical_appearance:This is a portrait painting of Lee Kuan Yew. He is dressed in a suit and tie. He is sitting sideways
 body facing towards the left. His gaze is towards the front. The painting uses muted colours of gray
 beige
 white and black. There is a signature on the bottom-right of the painting.

sgcool_label_text:This posthumous oil painting of Lee Kuan Yew by Alvin Ong depicts the first Prime Minister of Singapore as a young man. It is based on a photograph of Mr Lee at Assembly House (now known as the Arts House or Old Parliament House)
 in December 1958.

metadata.title_text: Painting of Lee Kuan Yew Lee Kuan Yew
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a portrait painting of Lee Kuan Yew. He is dressed in a suit and tie. He is sitting sideways, body facing towards the left. His gaze is towards the front. The painting uses muted colours of gray, beige, white and black. There is a signature on the bottom-right of the painting.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This posthumous oil painting of Lee Kuan Yew by Alvin Ong depicts the first Prime Minister of Singapore as a young man. It is based on a photograph of Mr Lee at Assembly House (now known as the Arts House or Old Parliament House), in December 1958.
